lead_paragraph: A New York councilman has introduced legislation that takes aim at the list, which advocates say includes tenants who won court cases or legally withheld rent because of decrepit conditions.

byline.original: By KIM BARKER and JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG

headline.print_headline: On Tenant Blacklist, Errors and Renters Who Have Little Recourse
headline.main: On Tenant Blacklist, Errors and Renters With Little Recourse

snippet: A New York councilman has introduced legislation that takes aim at the list, which advocates say includes tenants who won court cases or legally withheld rent because of decrepit conditions....
abstract: New York City Councilman Benjamin J Kallos introduces legislation to require that screening companies compiling tenant blacklists, used by landlords to weed out risky tenants, give more complete information about housing court cases; tenant lawyers say list is rife with errors and includes tenants who won cases or legally withheld rent due to squalid conditions.
